creator: sbailliez@apache.org
text:
So. What are we supposed to do here ?

No committers use VAJ and it looks like users have a whole range of opinions 
on these tasks ranging from crap to useless and incompatible.

We are supposed to be backward compatible but as IBM does not care much I 
don't see much reason for self inflicting pain on this one, though it would be 
me I would simply remove this task as this IDE obviouslly does not have a long 
future.

If you guys want a VAJ task, then you are forced to do the work and submit 
patches. There does not seem to be much interest on this, but if you do please 
provide a link so that we can download VAJ otherwise we won't be able to 
compile it - another 150Mo for an API !. If you don't then this task has to be 
officially put in deprecated mode.

creator: nawkboy@yahoo.com
text:
I am intending to submit patches to fix this when I complete a group of tasks I 
am working on.

I am working on a collection of tasks that when combined with the existing 
tasks will allow me to keep N number of VAJ repositories in sync via CVS.  More 
importantly any changes made directly in CVS will find their way into the VAJ 
repositories.

The tasks I am writting fall into two basic catagories, those that are VAJ 
Remote API related (make use of repaired versions of the standard VAJ tasks) 
and those that are CVS related.

The motivation for this crazy idea revolves around internal political issues 
that make leaving VAJ difficult.

I forgot to mention that nawkboy@yahoo.com and jlcarpenter@household.com are 
both me, James Lee Carpenter.  This is helpful to know when reading my 
newsgroup posts to ant-dev@jakarta.apache.org.  Most every post I have made so 
far, directly or indirectly relates to this issue.
